statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Loyola Marymount 68, Oral Roberts 65
article.story: LOS ANGELES (AP) -- Matthew Knight had 23 points and Brandon Worthy scored 19 to give Loyola Marymount a 68-65 victory over Oral Roberts in the season opener for both schools. Knight went 10-for-14 from the field and pulled down nine rebounds, and Worthy had seven assists. Ken Tutt of Oral Roberts led all scorers with 26 points, and Caleb Green had 12 points and a game-high 12 rebounds. Tutt made a 3-pointer to give Oral Roberts its biggest lead of the game, 44-37 with 16:12 to play in the second half. Worthy made a bank shot as he fell to the ground to pull Loyola Marymount within one, 50-49 with 9:17 to play. Knight then made a layup after a behind-the-back assist from Adoyah Miller to give the Lions their first lead of the second half, 51-50. Worthy later used a steal, breakaway and three-point play to give Loyola Marymount its biggest lead, 64-57, then made a pair of free throws to put the Lions up 66-60 in the final minute and seal the win. Derick Grubb added 10 points for Loyola Marymount. The Lions scored the first 11 points of the game, but the Golden Eagles answered with a 24-8 run that featured 12 points from Tutt to take a five-point lead, 24-19. The Lions came back to tie it at 26 and again at 30, but Green made a layup with 23 seconds left in the half to give Oral Roberts a 36-33 halftime lead. Tutt had 14 first-half points. Knight had 13 in the half on 6-for-6 shooting.
